participants.name: Russ White
participants.title: Co-Founder and Co-Publisher at Vegas Shade and QLife Magazine

messages.message: And a brief code review. You can tell a lot by how someone structures their code. Whether it's good or not comes down to how they think and communicate not how they write it.
Good points. I try to ask a lot of questions when communicating. Thank you for answering them!
Is it OK for me to connect to randoms and steal a few moments of their time as long as I am learning something? You are the first person to answer my question in a similar way that I did.
I dunno how others feel. I'm certainly okay with it.
The first person I connected with on Facebook that I'd never met before turned out to be one of my closest friends years later.
Excellent!
Happy Friday. So what are the tools in your arsenal these days? What do you like using? What are you exploring?

Good question! I love Docker. I use to call it Linux administration but now it's basically solved for me. I am using Nodejs on sosmethod.herokuapp.com. I am using PowerShell to automate access management provisioning at Schwab. I used PHP and Symfony for years but PHP is slow. PHP version 7 is supposed to be twice as fast. I use AWS and heroku, but I've tried blue shift and azure too and I like the competition in that market space. Internally I am exploring meditation. It is amazing how I feel more observant of others just from focused relaxation.
Happy Friday!

On the backend I'm using PHP, Laravel and Mongo (no more SQL anywhere). Front end is mostly jQuery and Bootstrap. I run exclusively on AWS. Laravel turned me on to Vagrant for my local dev environment. I've done iOS in the past, and will get back into it soon.

Cool. Swift is cool as a language but their API sucks. Microsoft already solved enumerable collections with LINQ I don't see why they don't just copy that for swift. Especially since swift has great generics. Laravel looks cool, similar to symfony. Finally someone who doesn't spout off about React.
Most of the API has to maintain compatibility with Cocoa/Obj-C parallels, and open-sourcing Swift leads me to some interesting ideas in the coming years.
Happy Monday.. How have you been?
Excellent. How are you? I just started a new job at swiftpage.
Congrats! I saw that. What are you doing there?
Looks like platform development. Having a good grasp of the entire codebase. Migrating to angular 2.
How are things going on your end?
I got laid off from my Silicon Valley job last month, but that now allows me to work on the magazine full time now. It's what I was planning on anyway, just happened a month before I was hoping for.
Oh that sucks, I am sorry. Good thing you have a backup plan.
It's always been the primary plan. Excited to be focused once again.
